page.title: 18Older Buildings
page.content: In the town there are examples from a wide range of building periods.A great fire in 1651 destroyed most of the early timber framed buildings, only Freddies Restaurant in Shropshire St and Westons Chip Shop in Stafford St survived.After the fire further timber framed buildings were built,examples include 3 pubs the Crown,the Vaults and the Star.Cotton House in Shropshire Street is a fine example.Few bricks were used.These were used in the foundation of the timber framed walls and in the central chimney around which the rest of the house was constructed.Bricks became more widely used after 1700 and 41 Shropshire St is a fine example of the use of brick in that period.Good examples of late Victorian peroid can be found in the Burgage ,Longslow Road, Clive Road and Victoria Road.
